item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Whatever comes," she said, "cannot alter one thing. If I am a princess in rags and tatters, I can be a princess inside. It would be easy to be a princess if I were dressed in cloth of gold, but it is a great deal more of a triumph to be one all the time when no one knows it." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Brian Selznick
item.description: " If you lose your purpose ... it's like you're broken. " -- Brian Selznick

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by John Masefield
item.description: "Life, a beauty chased by tragic laughter." -- John Masefield

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Tina Seelig
item.description: "There's a big difference between trying to do something and actually doing it. We often say we're trying to do something-losing weight, getting more exercise, finding a job. But the truth is, we're either doing it or not doing it." -- Tina Seelig

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Tina Seelig
item.description: "Never miss an opportunity to be fabulous." -- Tina Seelig

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Gretchen Rubin
item.description: "One of the great joys of falling in love is the feeling that the most extraordinary person in the entire world has chosen you." -- Gretchen Rubin

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is not our part to master all the tides of the world, but to do what is in us for the succour of those years wherein we are set, uprooting the evil in the fields that we know, so that those who live after may have clean earth to till. What weather they shall have is not ours to rule." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only person I really wanted to talk to about Augustus Water's death with was Augustus Waters." -- John Green

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You do not immortalize the lost by writing about them. Language buries, but does not resurrect." -- John Green

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You say you're not special because the world doesn't know about you, but that's an insult to me. I know about you." -- John Green

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Stories have changed, my dear boy,” the man in the grey suit says, his voice almost imperceptibly sad. “There are no more battles between good and evil, no monsters to slay, no maidens in need of rescue. Most maidens are perfectly capable of rescuing themselves in my experience, at least the ones worth something, in any case. There are no longer simple tales with quests and beasts and happy endings. The quests lack clarity of goal or path. The beasts take different forms and are difficult to recognize for what they are. And there are never really endings, happy or otherwise. Things keep overlapping and blur, your story is part of your sister’s story is part of many other stories, and there in no telling where any of them may lead. Good and evil are a great deal more complex than a princess and a dragon, or a wolf and a scarlet-clad little girl. And is not the dragon the hero of his own story? Is not the wolf simply acting as a wolf should act? Though perhaps it is a singular wolf who goes to such lengths as to dress as a grandmother to toy with its prey." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "We lead strange lives, chasing our dreams around from place to place." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The most difficult thing to read is time. Maybe because it changes so many things." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You're in the right place at the right time, and you care enough to do what needs to be done. Sometimes that's enough." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Most maidens are perfectly capable of rescuing themselves in my experience, at least the ones worth something, in any case." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "People don’t pay much attention to anything unless you give them reason to" -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Ernestasia add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "To be rather than to seem." -- Erin Morgenstern
